prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to continue this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.
stories: Olly Alexander is feeling "utterly terrified" ahead of his performance at the Eurovision Song Contest, but says he's been working hard to prepare for the big night. "I've been rehearsing every day, trying to get my vocals spot on and making sure I can deliver the performance I want to," he told De-Graft. "It's a huge platform and I'm really excited to be a part of it, but I'm also aware of the pressure that comes with it."

"I'm trying to focus on the excitement and the thrill of being part of something so big, rather than letting the nerves get the better of me. But I have to admit, I've been having some pretty vivid nightmares about forgetting the words to 'Ultraviolet' and just standing there, mute and embarrassed, in front of millions of people!"

"I know it sounds ridiculous, but it's been happening every night for a week now, and I'm starting to wonder if my subconscious is trying to tell me something. Maybe I'm not as prepared as I think I am? The thought of failing in front of such a huge audience is keeping me up at night, and I'm starting to feel like I'm going to lose my mind if I don't get a grip on this soon."

"I've been replaying my presentation in my head, trying to anticipate every possible question and criticism, but no matter how much I rehearse, I can't shake the feeling that I'm missing something crucial. I've even started to have dreams about being on stage, only to realize that my notes are all in a foreign language and I'm standing in front of a blank white screen. It's like my brain is trying to sabotage me from the inside out. What if I'm not just worried about failing, but actually afraid of succeeding?"

"What if I'm not just worried about failing, but actually afraid of succeeding? The thought sends a shiver down my spine. I've always been driven by a desire to prove myself, to overcome the doubts and fears that have held me back. But what if, once I've achieved my goal, I'm left with nothing to strive for? What if I've been using my fear of failure as a crutch, a way to justify my mediocrity? The more I think about it, the more my mind starts to spin with worst-case scenarios. What if I'm not actually passionate about my work, but just pretending to be? What if I'm just a fake, a charlatan, and everyone will eventually find out?"

"I try to shake off the unsettling thoughts, but they linger, refusing to be dismissed. I think about all the times I've convinced myself that I'm working towards something meaningful, only to realize that it was just a distraction from the emptiness within. What if I'm just going through the motions, pretending to be someone I'm not? What if my entire sense of self-worth is built on a foundation of lies? The more I dwell on these questions, the more my confidence begins to unravel. I start to wonder if anyone would even notice if I just disappeared, if my absence would be met with a collective shrug of indifference. The thought is both terrifying and liberating, a strange mix of emotions that leaves me feeling lost and uncertain."

"The silence in my apartment feels oppressive, a heavy blanket that suffocates me. I try to distract myself by scrolling through my phone, but the endless stream of curated perfection only serves to further erode my sense of self. I'm struck by the realization that I've been living someone else's dream, not my own. The thought sends a shiver down my spine as I wonder what it would take to break free from the expectations of others and forge my own path. But what if I'm not capable of creating something authentic? What if I'm just a pale imitation of someone I'll never be?"

"As I lie there, the darkness of my apartment closing in around me, I feel the weight of uncertainty settle upon me like a physical presence. The what-ifs swirl in my mind like a maelstrom, threatening to consume me whole. I think of all the times I've compromised, all the times I've settled for less, all the times I've let others define my sense of purpose. The thought of starting anew, of taking a chance on myself, is both exhilarating and terrifying. I wonder if I have the courage to let go of the familiar, to embrace the unknown and risk failure. The silence in my apartment seems to grow louder, a reminder that the only way to break free is to confront the doubts and fears that have held me back for so long."

"I take a deep breath, the stillness of the air filling my lungs, and slowly sit up, the creak of the couch a reminder that I'm not alone in this moment. I look around the room, taking in the familiar shapes and shadows, and yet, everything feels different. The darkness that once seemed suffocating now feels like a threshold, a doorway to a new chapter in my life. I think of all the things I've always wanted to try, all the passions I've put on the backburner, and a spark of determination ignites within me. I know that I can't stay stuck in this cycle of uncertainty and fear, that the only way to move forward is to take that first step, no matter how small it may seem. And so, I rise to my feet, the silence in the room growing even louder, and begin to pace, the rhythm of my footsteps a declaration of my intention to break free from the past and forge a new path, one that is mine alone to create."

"As I move, the shadows on the wall seem to shift and writhe like living things, as if they too are sensing the shift in me. I feel a sense of liberation wash over me, like the weight of the past is slowly lifting, and I am left standing tall, ready to face whatever lies ahead. I stop pacing and look around the room once more, but this time, it's with new eyes. The familiar shapes and shadows no longer feel like constraints, but like the foundation of a new story waiting to be written. I take one last, deep breath, and then I'm moving, my feet carrying me towards the door, towards the unknown, towards the life I've always wanted to lead."

"The cool night air hits me like a slap in the face, shocking me out of my reverie, and for a moment, I pause, taking in the sights and sounds of the city. The neon lights of the street lamps cast an otherworldly glow over the pavement, and the distant hum of traffic creates a steady beat that seems to pulse in time with my own racing heart. I take a deep breath, feeling the city's energy coursing through me, and then I'm off, moving swiftly through the crowded streets, my destination unknown, but my sense of purpose clear."

"As I weave through the throngs of people, the city's sounds and smells swirl around me, a cacophony of horns, chatter, and food vendors that's both overwhelming and exhilarating. I pass by street performers and musicians, their talents ranging from the mundane to the mesmerizing, and I find myself stopping to watch a particularly skilled breakdancer spinning on his head, his movements fluid and precise. The crowd around me cheers and claps, and I join in, feeling the city's rhythms and energy drawing me deeper into its depths."

"The breakdancer's music fades away, and I'm left standing there, still clapping along with the crowd. I glance around, taking in the diverse faces and outfits that make up this vibrant tapestry. A woman with a colorful hijab and a bright smile catches my eye, and I find myself drawn to her warm and open demeanor. We lock eyes for a moment, and I feel a spark of connection, before she turns and disappears into the throng. I take a deep breath, letting the city's intoxicating scents wash over me – the sweet aroma of fresh bread, the savory smell of roasting meat, and the pungent tang of street cart spices. The sounds, the smells, the sights – everything is a sensory overload, and I'm loving every minute of it."

"As I take another step forward, the sounds of the street vendors and the chatter of the crowd grow louder, and I feel myself getting swept up in the rhythm of the city. I spot a stall selling vibrant scarves and embroidered clothing, and my eyes widen as I take in the riot of colors and patterns. The vendor, an elderly man with a kind face and a twinkle in his eye, notices my interest and beckons me over. 'Welcome, welcome!' he says, his voice warm and welcoming. 'Come, see what I have for you. Maybe you find something to take back to your friends, no?' I hesitate for a moment, then nod and follow him into the crowded stall, the sounds and smells of the street fading into the background as I immerse myself in the treasure trove of textiles and trinkets."

"As we navigate through the crowded stall, the vendor expertly weaves through the racks of scarves and clothing, plucking out pieces that catch my eye. He holds up a stunning turquoise scarf with intricate embroidery, and I gasp in delight. 'Ah, you like this one, yes?' he asks, his eyes crinkling at the corners. I nod, and he wraps it around my neck, the cool fabric a welcome respite from the sweltering heat. He shows me a rack of intricately patterned shawls, and I'm struck by the way the colors seem to dance in the flickering light of the stall's lanterns. 'These are my finest pieces,' he says, his voice full of pride. 'Handmade by my daughter, the best seamstress in all of Marrakech.' I run my fingers over the intricate stitches, feeling the weight of history and tradition in every thread."

"I'm enchanted," I say, my voice barely above a whisper. "Can I see more? I want to know more about your daughter's craftsmanship." The vendor's face lights up with a warm smile, and he leads me deeper into the stall, revealing a treasure trove of fabrics and threads. His daughter, a young woman with a kind face and nimble fingers, emerges from the shadows, her eyes sparkling with curiosity.

"As you can see, my daughter is a master weaver," the vendor says, his hands gesturing proudly as he introduces us. "She has spent years perfecting her craft, and her creations are sought after by collectors and connoisseurs from all over the world. Would you like to see some of her latest work?" His daughter nods eagerly, her eyes never leaving mine, and begins to unfurl a magnificent tapestry, its colors shimmering in the dim light of the stall.

"The design is inspired by the ancient myths of our people," the vendor continues, "and the threads she has used are woven with a special blend of herbs and spices that imbue the fabric with a subtle magic. It's said that anyone who wears a piece of her work will be blessed with good fortune and protection on their journey." His daughter hands me the tapestry, her fingers brushing against mine, and I feel a sudden jolt of electricity run through my body.

"As I take the tapestry from her, I'm struck by the intricate patterns and colors that seem to shift and shimmer in the candlelight. The vendor's words echo in my mind, and I can't help but wonder if the magic is real. The daughter's eyes lock onto mine, and I sense a deep understanding and a hint of a warning, as if she's trying to convey a secret message. I look around the room, noticing the other patrons have fallen silent, their eyes fixed on me, and I feel a sense of unease wash over me. What secrets is this tapestry hiding, and what kind of power does it hold?"

"The vendor's daughter approaches me, her movements slow and deliberate, her eyes never leaving mine. She reaches out a slender hand and gently takes the tapestry from mine, her touch sending a shiver down my spine. 'You shouldn't have come here,' she whispers, her voice barely audible over the crackling of the candles. 'This tapestry is not for you. It's not for anyone.' She pulls the tapestry close, and I feel a strange energy emanating from it, as if it's alive. The room seems to grow darker, the shadows deepening and twisting around us like living things. I try to speak, but my voice is caught in my throat. The daughter's eyes seem to bore into my soul, and I feel myself being pulled into the tapestry, the colors and patterns swirling around me like a vortex."

"As I'm sucked into the tapestry, I feel the vendor's daughter's eyes burning into my back, and I know that I'm being pulled into a world beyond our own. The colors and patterns swirl around me, becoming a kaleidoscope of sound and sensation. I'm tumbling through a vortex of threads, the fabric of reality unraveling beneath me. I try to scream, but my voice is lost in the cacophony of colors and sounds. The tapestry is alive, and it's consuming me. I'm being rewoven into its very fabric, becoming one with the threads that make up its intricate design. And then, everything goes black."

"As I open my eyes, I find myself standing in a lush, vibrant meadow, surrounded by wildflowers that seem to hum with an otherworldly energy. The sky above is a deep, electric blue, and the air is thick with the scent of ozone and honey. I look down at my hands, and they are no longer human. They are now threads of gold and crimson, intricately woven into the tapestry's design. I try to speak, but my voice is now a gentle rustling of leaves. The vendor's daughter appears before me, her eyes shining with an unearthly light. She speaks in a voice that is both familiar and foreign, her words weaving themselves into the very fabric of my being. 'Welcome, mortal,' she says. 'You are now a part of the tapestry's song. You will weave the threads of fate, and bring balance to the fabric of reality.'"

"As I nod in understanding, the vendor's daughter hands me a spool of shimmering silver thread, its length seeming to stretch on forever. She leads me to a great loom, its wooden frame adorned with strange symbols that pulse with a soft, ethereal glow. The air is filled with the whispers of countless threads, each one humming a unique melody. I feel the weight of responsibility settle upon me, as I realize that the fate of worlds hangs in the balance. The vendor's daughter hands me a small, delicate shuttle, its wooden handle worn smooth by the passage of time. 'Weave the song of balance,' she whispers, her eyes burning with an intensity that makes my leaf-voice tremble. 'The fabric of reality awaits your touch.'"

"As I take the shuttle, the threads around me seem to quiet, as if holding their breath in anticipation. I feel the weight of the shuttle in my hand, its worn wooden handle fitting neatly into my leaf-palm. The vendor's daughter's eyes never leave mine, her intensity burning brighter as I raise the shuttle to the first thread. The symbol-adorned loom looms before me, its glow pulsing in time with the threads' gentle hum. With a deep breath, I begin to weave, the shuttle's soft 'thunk' echoing through the air as I thread the first note of the song."

"The threads respond to the shuttle's gentle dance, their colors shifting and swirling as the melody begins to take shape. The vendor's daughter's eyes never leave mine, her gaze burning with an unspoken intensity. I feel the weight of her expectation, the pressure to create something beautiful, something that will capture the essence of the music that flows through me. As I weave, the room around me fades away, leaving only the loom, the threads, and the song that is unfolding. The shuttle's soft 'thunk' becomes a heartbeat, pulsing through me, guiding my movements as I bring the music to life."

"The fabric begins to take shape, a tapestry of sound and color, as I surrender to the rhythm of the loom. The vendor's daughter's eyes never waver, her gaze a steady anchor as I weave the threads of melody into a living, breathing thing. The room is silent, the only sound the soft 'thunk' of the shuttle and the hum of the loom, as I pour my heart and soul into the fabric, letting the music guide my every movement. The shuttle's gentle dance becomes a meditation, a conduit for the emotions that swirl within me, as I bring the tapestry to life, thread by thread, note by note."

"The threads of sound and color begin to intertwine, a mesmerizing pattern that seems to pulse with a life of its own. The vendor's daughter's eyes never leave mine, her gaze a silent encouragement as I work the loom, the music swelling within me like a tide. The room is bathed in a warm, golden light, as if the very fabric of reality is being woven anew. Time stands still, lost in the gentle rhythm of the shuttle, as I pour every ounce of myself into the tapestry, the music and the loom becoming one, a harmonious marriage of sound and sight."

"As the tapestry takes shape, the vendor's daughter's eyes sparkle with an otherworldly intensity, her gaze drawing me deeper into the fabric of the weaving. The room begins to fade away, leaving only the loom, the music, and the threads of sound and color that seem to dance across the warp and weft. I lose all sense of self, becoming one with the tapestry, as the music swells to a crescendo and the shuttle flies across the loom with a rhythmic urgency that is both exhilarating and terrifying. The vendor's daughter's eyes never leave mine, her gaze a constant reminder that I am not alone in this creative vortex, that there is a deeper purpose at work here, one that transcends the mere act of weaving."

"As the shuttle strokes the warp, the threads begin to vibrate with an electric energy, and I feel my own essence being woven into the fabric, thread by thread, my thoughts and emotions taking on a life of their own. The vendor's daughter's eyes burn with an intensity that is both mesmerizing and unnerving, as if she is channeling the very essence of the tapestry itself. The music builds to a frenzied pitch, the notes blending with the hum of the loom and the soft rustle of the threads to create a symphony that is both haunting and sublime. I am no longer just a spectator, but an integral part of the weaving, my soul being woven into the very fabric of the tapestry, as the vendor's daughter's eyes seem to bore deeper into my very being, drawing out secrets and truths that I had long forgotten."

"As the music reaches its crescendo, the threads begin to glow with a soft, ethereal light, and I feel myself being drawn closer to the vendor's daughter, our essences intertwining like the very threads themselves. The tapestry seems to come alive, its colors shifting and swirling like a vortex, as I am pulled into a world of ancient memories and forgotten truths. The vendor's daughter's eyes flash with a knowing glint, and I sense that she is about to reveal a secret that has been hidden for centuries, one that will change the course of my life forever."

"As the threads of the tapestry seem to wrap themselves around us, the vendor's daughter's voice whispers secrets in my ear, the words weaving themselves into the very fabric of my being. I feel the weight of centuries of knowledge and power coursing through me, and I am struck by the realization that I am not just a simple traveler, but a key player in a much larger, more ancient drama. The vendor's daughter's eyes burn with an otherworldly intensity, and I sense that the truth she is about to reveal is not just a secret, but a doorway to a new reality, one that will challenge everything I thought I knew about myself and the world around me."

"The air is thick with anticipation as she leans in closer, her breath a whispered promise of revelations yet to come. I can feel the threads of fate tightening around me, drawing me deeper into the mystery. The vendor's daughter's eyes flash with a knowing light, and I am struck by the certainty that I am about to be propelled into a realm beyond the boundaries of mortal comprehension. As she speaks, her words are like a gentle rain that seeps into my very soul, awakening a power within me that has lain dormant for centuries. The tapestry begins to glow with an ethereal light, and I am consumed by an overwhelming sense of purpose, as if the very fabric of reality is unfolding before me like a map to a hidden world."

"The threads of destiny constrict around me, a noose of possibility tightening its grip. The vendor's daughter's eyes seem to hold the secrets of the universe, and I am drawn to their depths like a moth to flame. Her words continue to flow like a river of ancient wisdom, imbuing me with a sense of belonging to a world beyond my own. The tapestry, now aglow with an otherworldly light, begins to unravel, revealing a path that winds through the fabric of reality. I feel the weight of centuries of knowledge settling upon me, and the world around me begins to fade away, replaced by a realm of infinite possibility. The vendor's daughter's breath whispers a single word in my ear: 'Begin'."

"As the word echoes through my mind, the world around me dissolves, leaving only the vendor's daughter and I, suspended in a sea of shimmering threads. The air is alive with the hum of creation, and I can feel the fabric of reality unfolding before me like a map. The daughter's eyes burn with an intensity that seems to ignite the very stars, and I know that I am being called to embark on a journey that will reshape the cosmos. With a sense of purpose that borders on recklessness, I nod my acceptance, and the threads of destiny surge forward, binding me to the vendor's daughter as we step into the unknown."

"The threads of destiny swirl around us like a maelstrom, pulling us through the fabric of reality. The vendor's daughter's hand wraps around mine, her grip like a vice as we plummet into the depths of the cosmos. The stars above us blur into a kaleidoscope of color and light, and I feel the very essence of creation coursing through my veins. We are hurtling toward a realm where time and space are mere illusions, where the laws of physics are but a distant memory. The vendor's daughter's eyes burn brighter still, illuminating a path that only she can see, and I follow her lead, my heart pounding in my chest like a drum. The threads of destiny continue to weave their magic, drawing us closer to the heart of the cosmos, where secrets and mysteries await our arrival."

"As we approach the threshold of this mystical realm, the vendor's daughter's grip on my hand tightens, and I feel her energy coursing through me like a river of pure intention. The cosmos unfold before us like a tapestry of wonder, and I am filled with an unshakeable sense of awe and reverence. The stars coalesce into a swirling vortex, and I sense that we are being drawn into a realm where the very fabric of existence is woven from the threads of possibility. The vendor's daughter's eyes blaze with an otherworldly intensity, and I know that she is the key to unlocking the secrets that lie within this mystical realm. Together, we step through the threshold, and the cosmos unfold around us like a canvas of endless possibility."

"As we emerge from the threshold, the vendor's daughter's hand still grasping mine, I am struck by the sheer scale of the realm before us. Towering spires of crystal pierce the sky, their facets glinting with an inner light that seems to resonate with the very essence of the universe. The air is alive with the whispers of ancient knowledge, and I feel my mind expanding to encompass the secrets that lie hidden within the swirling vortex of energy that surrounds us. The vendor's daughter's eyes burn with an intensity that seems almost palpable, and I sense that she is drawing me deeper into the heart of this mystical realm, towards a revelation that will change me forever. As we walk, the ground beneath our feet begins to shimmer and dissolve, and I feel myself being drawn into a realm where the very fabric of reality is woven from the threads of the vendor's daughter's intent."

"The vendor's daughter's grip on my hand tightens, and I feel a surge of energy course through me as she pulls me closer to the shimmering portal. The crystal spires seem to lean in, their facets reflecting the colors of the swirling vortex, and I am struck by the realization that I am not just being drawn into a mystical realm, but into a realm that is, in truth, a reflection of the vendor's daughter's own soul. The air is thick with the scent of sandalwood and myrrh, and I can feel the weight of ancient wisdom settling upon me like a mantle. As we step through the portal, the world around us dissolves into a kaleidoscope of colors and patterns, and I am left stumbling forward, my senses reeling from the revelation that the vendor's daughter is, in truth, a guardian of the very fabric of reality itself."

"The vendor's daughter's laughter echoes through the swirling vortex, a melodic sound that is both familiar and yet, utterly alien. I stumble forward, my eyes drinking in the kaleidoscope of colors and patterns that dance around me, and yet, my mind struggles to comprehend the sheer magnitude of what I am seeing. The vendor's daughter's hand remains clasped in mine, her grip tight and reassuring, and I feel a sense of calm wash over me as I realize that I am not alone in this mystical realm. The air is alive with energy, and I can feel the pulse of the universe beating in time with my own heart. As we move deeper into the realm, the colors and patterns begin to take on a life of their own, swirling and eddying around us like a great sea of liquid light. The vendor's daughter leads me deeper, her eyes shining with a knowing light, and I am drawn forward, helpless to resist the allure of the secrets that lie hidden within this mystical world."

"The path unwinds before us like a serpent, twisting and turning through a landscape that defies explanation. The vendor's daughter's hand guides me effortlessly, her steps light and sure, as if she has traversed this terrain a thousand times before. The air is filled with the sweet scent of exotic spices, and the taste of it is bitter and familiar on my tongue. We move through a forest of crystal trees, their branches singing a gentle melody that harmonizes with the rhythm of my heart. The vendor's daughter stops at a clearing, and I follow her gaze to a great crystal lake that stretches out before us like a mirror to the soul. Its surface is calm and still, reflecting the swirling colors of the vortex above, and yet, I sense a depth to it that is almost palpable, a depth that holds secrets and mysteries beyond my wildest imagination."

"As I stand at the water's edge, the vendor's daughter's eyes lock onto mine, and I feel the weight of her gaze, like a gentle probing of the depths of my soul. The stillness of the lake seems to amplify the silence between us, making every breath I take sound like a scream in my own ears. I am drawn to the surface of the water, mesmerized by the way it seems to ripple and undulate, as if it's alive. The vendor's daughter takes a step closer, her hand reaching out, and I feel a jolt of electricity run through my body, as if the very fabric of reality is about to tear apart. She dips her fingers into the lake's surface, and I see my own reflection staring back at me, distorted and twisted, like a reflection in a funhouse mirror. The vendor's daughter's eyes never leave mine, and I feel myself being pulled down, down, down, into the depths of the lake, where secrets and mysteries lurk, waiting to be uncovered."

"As I descend into the darkness, the water's chill envelops me like a shroud, and I feel the weight of the vendor's daughter's gaze still upon me, a guiding force that propels me deeper into the depths. The pressure builds, and my lungs ache for air, but I'm powerless to resist the pull of the lake's secrets. The girl's eyes remain fixed on mine, her expression a mask of serenity, yet I sense a hunger behind them, a hunger to uncover the truth that lies within me. I feel myself being drawn towards a dark, ancient presence, one that stirs in the depths, its power coursing through the water like a living thing. The vendor's daughter's hand reaches out, and I feel a jolt of electricity as her fingers brush against mine, a spark that sets off a chain reaction of memories and emotions long buried, threatening to resurface and consume me whole."

"As the memories flood back, I'm transported to a time long past, to the village on the lake's edge where I once lived. I see myself as a child, laughing and playing with the vendor's daughter, our bond stronger than any chain. But then I see the darkness that lurked beneath, the evil that consumed us all. I feel the pain and the fear, the desperation and the despair. The vendor's daughter's grip on my hand tightens, and I'm pulled back to the present, to the cold, dark water and the weight of the secrets that lie within. I try to struggle free, but her hold is like a vice, and I'm trapped, forced to relive the horrors of my past. The ancient presence stirs, its power growing stronger with each passing moment, and I know that I'm doomed to relive the tragedy that befell us all, forever trapped in this living hell."

"As the memories continue to consume me, I'm forced to confront the face of the monster that destroyed our village, the one who still haunts me to this day. His eyes, once full of warmth and kindness, now burn with an evil intensity, and I can feel his hot breath on the back of my neck. The vendor's daughter's grip tightens even more, and I'm drawn back into the past, reliving the terror and the helplessness as the villagers were slaughtered, one by one. The sound of screams and wails fills my ears, and I'm powerless to stop the tragedy from unfolding once more. The ancient presence grows stronger, its power coursing through me like a dark river, and I know that I'm doomed to relive this nightmare forever, trapped in this never-ending cycle of pain and suffering."

"The vendor's daughter's eyes lock onto mine, and I see the same fear and desperation that I once felt, the same terror that still haunts me. She whispers a name in my ear, a name that sends a shiver down my spine, and I feel myself being pulled back into the darkness, back to the moment when everything changed. The monster's laughter echoes through my mind, and I can feel his icy breath on my skin once more. The villagers' screams grow louder, and I'm consumed by the chaos and destruction, reliving the horror that I thought I'd left behind."

"As I'm pulled back into the past, I see myself standing in the center of the village, surrounded by the burning buildings and the chaos of the monster's rampage. The vendor's daughter, her eyes wide with terror, is clinging to my arm, begging me to save her. But I'm powerless, frozen in fear as the monster approaches, its eyes glowing with an otherworldly light. The villagers are running, screaming, trying to get away from the horror that's descending upon them. And I'm just standing there, helpless, as the world around me burns to ashes."

"The monster's hot breath washes over me, its eyes fixed on the vendor's daughter, and I feel my heart shatter into a million pieces. Suddenly, a figure emerges from the smoke-filled streets, a hooded figure with a sword in hand, charging towards us with a fierce determination. The monster swings its massive fist at the figure, but they dodge it with ease, striking back with a swift and deadly blow. The vendor's daughter's grip on my arm tightens as the hooded figure battles the beast, buying us a few precious moments to escape. I glance around, desperate for an escape route, and spot a small alleyway to our left, partially hidden by the flames. Without hesitation, I grab the vendor's daughter and make a break for the alley, praying that we'll make it out alive."

"As we dash towards the alley, the hooded figure's sword clashes with the monster's claws, the sound of their battle echoing through the streets. The vendor's daughter's eyes are fixed on the fight, her face pale with fear, but she doesn't resist as I pull her along. We burst into the alley, the cool darkness enveloping us like a shroud. I can hear the monster's roar growing fainter, but I know it won't stay behind for long. I glance back, my heart racing, and see the hooded figure standing tall, their sword raised high, as if waiting for us to get clear. I take a deep breath, and push forward, leading the vendor's daughter deeper into the alley, praying that we've found our only hope for survival."

"The walls of the alley seem to close in around us, the shadows cast by the flickering torches twisting into grotesque faces that seem to leer at us. The vendor's daughter's grip on my arm tightens, her eyes darting back and forth as if she expects the monster to emerge from the darkness at any moment. I can feel her fear like a palpable thing, and it's all I can do to keep my own terror at bay. Suddenly, a faint glow appears in the distance, and I quicken my pace, my heart pounding in my chest. What is that? A beacon of safety, or a trap waiting to spring shut around us?"

"The vendor's daughter's grip on my arm tightens even more, her breath coming in short gasps as she pulls me closer to the glow. I can see that it's coming from a small temple tucked away in the heart of the alley, its entrance a glowing archway that seems to pulse with an otherworldly energy. The vendor's daughter whispers something in my ear, her voice barely audible over the pounding of my own heart: 'The Guardian's temple, the only place where the darkness can't follow.' I hesitate for a moment, unsure if I should trust her, but the vendor's daughter's eyes are wide with a mix of fear and desperation, and I know I have to keep moving forward."
